channel.title: Congress on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Congress on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: US Congressman’s Brother Lands No-Bid Contract to Train DHS Snipers
item.description: DHS says retired Marine sniper Dan LaLota’s firm is uniquely qualified to meet the government’s needs. LaLota tells WIRED his brother, GOP congressman Nick LaLota, played no role in the contract.

item.title: US Congressman’s Brother Lands No-Bid Contract to Train DHS Snipers
item.description: DHS says retired Marine sniper Dan LaLota’s firm is uniquely qualified to meet the government’s needs. LaLota tells WIRED his brother, GOP congressman Nick LaLota, played no role in the contract.

item.title: Former NASA chief says United States likely to lose second lunar space race
item.description: “It is highly unlikely the United States will beat China’s projected timeline.”

item.title: Lawmaker: Trump’s Golden Dome will end the madness, and that’s not a good thing
item.description: “I don’t want to gamble on which major city or two we lose in a scenario like that.”

item.title: The fight over science funding: Congress vs. the OMB
item.description: The Senate is restoring science funding to normal levels; that may not be enough.

item.title: Texas politicians warn Smithsonian it must not lobby to retain its space shuttle
item.description: Generating “…public resistance to the provision’s enforcement.”

item.title: Lawmakers writing NASA’s budget want a cheaper upper stage for the SLS rocket
item.description: Eliminating the Block 1B upgrade now would save NASA at least $500 million per year.

item.title: As White House talks about impounding NASA funding, Congress takes the threat seriously
item.description: “NASA appears to be acting in accordance with a fringe, extremist ideology.”

item.title: Congress moves to reject bulk of White House’s proposed NASA cuts
item.description: We’re still months away from these budget bills having a chance to become law.
